translation.en: [woman] I think everyone would love to just meet someone in a bar or in a grocery store.
translation.ko: 다들 술집이나 마트에서 누군가를 만나고 싶을 거예요

translation.en: But nowadays, the best way you can meet someone is on a dating app.
translation.ko: 근데 요즘은 데이트 앱으로 인연 맺는 게 최선이죠

translation.en: You can find a bit of everything on Tinder.
There are people looking for long-term relationships or marriage.
translation.ko: 장기 연애나 결혼을 원하는 사람도 있고

translation.en: People who just want to hook up.
Anything.
You can pick guys from all over the world.
translation.ko: 전 세계 남자들을 만날 수 있죠

translation.en: It's a lot of men.
We are all looking for that diamond in the rough.
translation.ko: 다들 진흙 속에서 진주를 찾고 있죠

translation.en: And of course, you Google everyone that you're supposed to go on a date with.
translation.ko: 물론 데이트 상대는 전부 검색해 보잖아요 "사이먼, 28세 3.2km 거리에 있음"

translation.en: Well, this is gonna be fun. Let's swipe right on that.
Private jets, cool cars, amazing parties all over the world.
translation.ko: 전용기 멋진 차 전 세계의 끝내주는 파티까지

translation.en: What happened to me felt like a movie.
But in the movies, there's always bad guys.
I get these threatening messages.
These enemies were watching me, my family.
[crying] It's just been fricking hell.
[woman 2] I'm shit scared.
Are they coming now? Did we lock the door?
I don't think I ever will be the same again.
translation.ko: 다신 예전으로 못 돌아갈 것 같아요

translation.en: [woman] One little swipe can change your life forever.
translation.ko: 한 번의 손놀림이 삶을 영원히 바꿀 수 있죠

translation.en: I think the… I think life is about love,
translation.ko: 제가 볼 때 인생은 사랑이 전부 같아요

translation.en: 'cause the most happiest times I've had is when I've been in love.
translation.ko: 전 사랑에 빠졌을 때 가장 행복했거든요 "세실리에 피엘회위"

translation.en: That's what's most amazing about love, no matter how many heartbreaks you've had,
translation.ko: 사랑의 가장 큰 매력은 몇 번을 상처받고도

translation.en: you still go after it.
-I love dating. -[phone chimes]
The moment I get nervous, then I know that there's something special here.
translation.ko: 떨리는 순간 특별한 상대란 느낌이 와요

translation.en: And I love being nervous. That's the thing. [chuckles]
I'm after that all-consuming, the kind of…
translation.ko: 전 모든 걸 바치는 사랑을 원해요

translation.en: What you've grown up with.
The first memories that I have about love is Disney.
translation.ko: 사랑에 대한 첫 기억은 디즈니 영화였죠

translation.en: I had memorized the entire Beauty and the Beast cassette.
I knew all the songs.
I just love Belle.
She is this small-town girl like me, hoping for something bigger.
translation.ko: 저 같은 시골 소녀로 커다란 꿈을 꾸는데

translation.en: She meets this person, and then she saves him in a sense,
or he saves her as well. Like, to go into a different life together.
translation.ko: 벨도 구원받아서 둘이 새 삶을 함께하죠

translation.en: It just sticks with you, like, the feeling of a prince coming to save you.
translation.ko: 왕자님이 구하러 오리라는 느낌은 여운으로 남아요

translation.en: And I think that even though you know it's not real, it's still with you a bit.
translation.ko: 현실이 아니란 걸 알면서도 살짝 기대하게 되죠

translation.en: I think everyone has that little bit of hope deep down inside
translation.ko: 누구나 가슴속 깊이 일말의 희망을 품잖아요

translation.en: it will be as magical as they were portraying it to be.
But finding Prince Charming in real life…
translation.ko: 근데 현실에서 백마 탄 왕자를 찾는 건

translation.en: It's a lot of work.
I've been on Tinder for seven years.
I'm from Norway, but live in London. So I've been on Tinder in two countries.
translation.ko: 전 노르웨이 출신인데 런던에 사니까 두 나라에서 틴더를 해 봤죠

translation.en: [interviewer] How many matches have you had?
Do you really want to see?
-[interviewer] Can we see? -Yeah.
[interviewer] 1,024 matches.
Yeah, I'm a bit of a Tinder expert. You can say that. [laughs]
translation.ko: 네, 전 틴더 전문가라고 할 수 있죠

translation.en: The most important thing that you can have is a picture of your face,
then you have a picture with friends.
It's important to show that you're social as well.
Feel my profile showing I'm not in the hook-up culture.
translation.ko: 제 프로필을 보면 가벼운 만남은 싫어하고

translation.en: Like, I'm after long-term love.
For me to swipe right on a guy,
it needs to be that we have some similar interests in the pictures I'm looking at.
translation.ko: 프로필 사진에 담긴 관심사가 비슷해야 해요

translation.en: Maybe like a nice dinner somewhere,
or that you like the beach, 'cause I love a beach.
translation.ko: 해변을 좋아해야 하죠 전 해변이 좋거든요

translation.en: Oh my God. Um, animals.
A handsome man with a cat? Like, it can't go wrong.
And you want a guy that has ambition.
It's like Marilyn Monroe in the movie Gentlemen Prefer Blondes.
translation.ko: 영화 '신사는 금발을 좋아해'의 매릴린 먼로를 보면

translation.en: And then she has this quote where she says…
Don't you know that a man being rich is like a girl being pretty?
translation.ko: 남자의 재력은 여자의 미모와 같다는 거 몰라요?

translation.en: You might not marry a girl just because she's pretty,
translation.ko: 그저 여자가 예쁘다는 이유로 결혼하진 않지만

translation.en: but my goodness, doesn't it help?
It is a very true quote. Like, you want the full package.
translation.ko: 그건 진리예요 다 가진 사람을 만나야죠

translation.en: But it's not easy to find what you're looking for.
It's a lot of swiping. Back and forth, back and forth.
When I saw Simon's pictures, he had the kind of look that I like.
translation.ko: 사이먼의 사진을 보니 외모는 제 타입이었어요

translation.en: He was dressed very stylish. I love a guy in a suit, and he had several of those.
translation.ko: 옷차림도 멋졌죠 남자라면 역시 정장인데 그런 사진이 많았거든요

translation.en: And he had his link to his Instagram.
You always check the Insta.
He had so many pictures and so many followers.
Business meetings, parties, beaches.
This guy is just having a very different life than I ever will experience.
translation.ko: 그 남자는 제가 평생 꿈도 못 꿀 인생을 살길래

translation.en: And I was just thinking that it would be kind of cool just to meet up.
I decide to swipe right.
And then he just responds fairly quickly.
"I'm leaving London tomorrow. Do you want to meet up?"
When we text on WhatsApp, he asked me to meet him
translation.ko: 왓츠앱으로 문자 하다가 자기가 묵는 포시즌스 호텔로 절 부르더군요

translation.en: at the hotel that he was staying at, the Four Seasons…
translation.ko: 자기가 묵는 포시즌스 호텔로 절 부르더군요

translation.en: …and he just sent the Google Maps link, so I could know where I was gonna go.
translation.ko: 잘 찾아오라며 구글 지도 링크도 보냈고요

translation.en: This was just going to be, like, an hour-long coffee,
'cause I could just sense that this guy was a busy guy.
When I walk into this really fancy hotel, I feel out of place.
I think I'm a bit early. So I just decide to sit down and wait.
translation.ko: 제가 일찍 온 것 같아서 앉아서 기다리기로 했죠

translation.en: You know, you're nervous.
When the elevator door finally pings…
I was like, "Shit."
He looks exactly like his pictures.
He has this magnetism.
There's something about this guy that is special.
One of the first topics we talked about was his job.
He's the CEO of LLD Diamonds.
He got the job from his dad.
When he mentioned that his dad was the king of diamonds,
so that meant that he was the prince of diamonds,
I realized, like, "My God, what kind of family is this?"
Very quickly, he'd become very personal. And that's what I really liked about it.
translation.ko: 순식간에 사적인 얘기도 털어놓던데 그래서 마음에 들었어요

translation.en: He has a baby daughter that turns two in a couple of weeks.
translation.ko: 몇 주 후면 2살이 되는 딸이 있다는데

translation.en: She's there now to visit him in London,
but he's not together with the mom anymore.
He's rarely in one place for a very long period of time,
and he just missed having someone, you know.
When we were nearing the end of the date,
he said, "I really want to get to know you better."
They were traveling to Bulgaria for a business trip,
and then he was asking me if I wanted to join them.
We're traveling by private jet.
"Shit. Ooh, this is something new that I've never done before."
I felt that I would be stupid if I said no.
So I was kind of, like, super excited on the inside,
but on the outside, I kept it very cool, because I was just thinking,
"Okay, you like this guy, you just need to keep your cool now."
Simon asked one of his drivers to take me back home,
translation.ko: 사이먼이 기사를 붙여 주며 집에 다녀오래요

translation.en: so I could pack some stuff, get my passport,
then they will drive me back.
Suddenly, there's this Rolls-Royce waiting for me.
So I was kind of like, "My God. This is insane."
It felt like being in a movie.
[announcer] Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer presents
an exciting, extravagant, romantic adventure.
The Yellow Rolls-Royce.
I can be quick when I pack.
I have a messenger group with my girlfriends.
My friends are freaking out.
"Who is this guy? How do you know him? You can be abducted."
I was like, "Oh, I didn't even think about that. I'm on a date, you know."
translation.ko: 전 거기까진 생각 못 했고 그냥 데이트라고 했죠

translation.en: At the airport, there is the entire team waiting for us.
A really tall guy, which I presume is the bodyguard.
There's a couple of drivers, and you have his little daughter.
translation.ko: 운전사 몇 명과 사이먼의 어린 딸도 있었죠

translation.en: I see this woman that's with Simon's daughter.
translation.ko: 어떤 여자가 사이먼의 딸을 안고 있던데

translation.en: Simon tells me that that's the baby's mother
and that they're going to be on the plane with us.
His ex is joining us on our first date together,
and I'm kind of like, "Well, this can be interesting."
[Simon] Morning. How are you? Ah, good. Morning.
translation.ko: 좋은 아침, 잘 지냈죠? 훌륭하군, 좋은 아침이에요

translation.en: [interviewer] Did you take videos on the plane? Show me?
[laughs] Yes. It's like the worst person.
That's what one of my friends would say.
"Can you stop being so awkward?" But I was very excited about it, you know.
translation.ko: 어색하게 굴지 좀 말라고요 근데 워낙 신났거든요

translation.en: It was champagne with caviar. I've never eaten caviar before.
And then it was sushi. And it was like it was a totally different world.
translation.ko: 초밥까지 있던데 전혀 다른 세상 같았어요

translation.en: If I like someone, I'll give them a little kiss on the cheek.
translation.ko: 전 누가 좋으면 볼에 뽀뽀해 주거든요

translation.en: It was quick, but it just felt very natural.
When we landed, me and the baby's mother and the baby, we went into a car.
translation.ko: 착륙해서 애 엄마랑 아기는 저랑 같은 차에 탔어요

translation.en: Of course, I take the opportunity to ask some questions.
She tells me what a wonderful father he is,
translation.ko: 그 여자 말이 사이먼은 훌륭한 아버지고

translation.en: that he's still supporting them even though they're not together anymore,
translation.ko: 서로 갈라섰지만 자기 모녀를 부양해 준다길래

translation.en: which was really, really nice to hear.
When we go to the hotel, we check in,
and when we're walking into the elevator together,
exactly when the door closes,
he takes me around the waist and he just looks at me
translation.ko: 사이먼이 제 허리를 감싸고 절 보며 끌어당기더니

translation.en: and he draws me in and just gives me this kiss,
translation.ko: 사이먼이 제 허리를 감싸고 절 보며 끌어당기더니 입을 맞췄는데

translation.en: and I was like, "Oh, shit," you know, the kind of butterflies…
It was passionate, and was just the perfect first kiss that you could have, you know.
-[interviewer] You sleep together? -We sleep together.
And then, later on, I could see that he has some marks on his back.
translation.ko: 나중에 보니 사이먼 등에 상처가 났더라고요

translation.en: I was just wondering, like, what is this? Where, like, I was touching it.
And then he was kind of like, "Oh, well…"
He didn't exactly know how to say it, but it was, like,
he had been in jail in South Africa. And I was like, "What?"
translation.ko: 남아공에서 감옥에 다녀왔다는데 전 깜짝 놀랐어요

translation.en: Just trust me once more.
Why should I?
He had a deal going on there, and they had
translation.ko: 계약을 추진하던 중 상대가 배신했다는 거예요

translation.en: turned their backs against him and betrayed him.
So he had gone in prison on false pretenses.
He was innocent.
He had been manhandled in prison because he was Jewish.
Here was this guy I thought had everything going for him
sitting on the bed with me, being really vulnerable.
translation.ko: 저랑 침대에 나란히 앉아 연약한 모습을 보였죠

translation.en: Just give me the stamps.
Oh. Oh, I love you, Adam, Alex, Peter…
[Cecilie] Here's this kind of person that you want to save,
especially 'cause he has so much responsibility on his back.
Everyone is relying on him.
Even though things had gone very quickly with us,
but when I sit there and I feel an emotional connection with someone
and they're opening up, that's just how I am as a person.
He starts getting a lot of calls, and, in the end, he just says,
translation.ko: 사이먼 전화기가 자꾸 울리니까 결국 이렇게 말했죠

translation.en: "We're so busy. I think it's best if you just go back home."
translation.ko: '우린 바쁘니까 당신은 집으로 가는 게 좋겠어'

translation.en: I was a bit disappointed, actually. I was kind of like…
I wanted to spend more time with him.
When I came back to London, I thought the conversation would die out.
translation.ko: 런던에 돌아와선 대화가 끊길 줄 알았고

translation.en: I didn't expect anything.
I felt like I knew him more, but I didn't really "know him" know him.
translation.ko: 좀 친해지긴 했어도 그 사람을 다 알진 못하니까요

translation.en: Like, how special was I? I felt special, but, like, when he leaves, you never know.
translation.ko: 전 얼마나 특별했을까요? 특별하다고 느끼긴 했지만 남자가 떠나면 모를 일이죠

translation.en: I was hoping. I was really hoping
that he was gonna come back.
But then kept going with, like, good morning messages to each other
translation.ko: 이어서 문자를 주고받았죠 아침이나 밤 인사를 나누고

translation.en: and good night messages, and FaceTime.
translation.ko: 아침이나 밤 인사를 나누고 영상 통화도 했어요

translation.en: He was, like, tagging me where he was going.
When I was at work, you could hear the pinging in your phone,
and it was, like, "I hope that it's him."
He just suddenly asked me, "So what's your address?"
Never, ever received a bouquet like that.
[Simon] Miss you. Wanna spend some time together… Kiss you, hug you.
translation.ko: 보고 싶어, 같이 있고 싶다 키스하고 안고 싶네

translation.en: Feel like we have something special, and he says so to me.
translation.ko: 우린 특별하다고 느꼈는데 그런 말까지 하길래

translation.en: So I'm kind of like, "Oh, shit. Is this it?"
Ah, it was so nice seeing him again.
I can't even describe to someone. Like, when you really want to see someone.
translation.ko: 너무도 그리운 그 느낌은 말로 표현 못 해요

translation.en: Just feeling that you're his girl is like the best feeling.
translation.ko: 사이먼의 여자가 된 기분은 비할 데가 없었거든요

translation.en: But then it was difficult to meet up with him. He was traveling a lot for business.
translation.ko: 근데 우린 만나긴 힘들었죠 사이먼은 출장이 잦았거든요

translation.en: I was going home to Oslo and I was thinking,
translation.ko: 오슬로 집으로 가는 길에 이런 생각이 스쳤죠

translation.en: "Well, you can come to Oslo!"
And that was one of the things he said,
"But, babe, I don't have anything to do in Oslo. There's no business,"
and I was missing him so much, I was like, "I'm never gonna be able to see you."
translation.ko: 사이먼이 어찌나 그립던지 영영 못 보는 줄 알았어요

translation.en: You're kidding me.
You're such a busy guy, and you decide to take a private jet
and land at like 3:00 a.m. to come and see me.
So I go to his hotel. I bought him, like, a Valentine's present.
translation.ko: 그 사람 호텔로 갔어요 밸런타인데이 선물도 샀는데

translation.en: It was a book about having a relationship with a Norwegian.
And then I had made, like, ten things about him that makes him wonderful, which I'd written myself.
translation.ko: 사이먼의 열 가지 매력도 직접 적어 갔고요

translation.en: And then he just asked me,
"I am serious about you. Do you want to be my girlfriend?"
And I'm kind of like, "Oh, shit." The kind of words that you wanted to hear.
translation.ko: 전 속으로 기뻤어요 듣고 싶었던 말이니까요

translation.en: Yeah. And then we were together.
That's when he said there was something he wants to tell me
if we're gonna be together.
It was better to be open and honest about how his life was
than to keep it hidden.
He was just talking about this big deal that he needed to get done,
and the deal was worth $70 million,
but the diamond industry is a dangerous business.
He had these threats surrounding his security.
He had a security team in Israel. Peter was like the head of it.
translation.ko: 이스라엘엔 경호 팀이 있는데 피터가 팀장이랬죠

translation.en: Threats had gotten worse.
He showed me pictures of, like, they had gotten bullets in the mail.
translation.ko: 우편으로 받은 총알 사진도 보여 줬어요

translation.en: Funeral flowers had been sent.
He had CCTV of an apartment in Tel Aviv.
He had a break-in there.
The security team told him that he wasn't safe in London anymore,
translation.ko: 경호 팀이 사이먼한테 이제 런던은 위험하니

translation.en: and for time being he needed to stay away.
Of course, I get super scared for him.
I could just see that it was straining on him.
He just wanted my understanding that things were gonna be fine,
translation.ko: 사이먼이 제 이해를 구하며 다 괜찮아질 거고

translation.en: and we were going to be together.
And I was like, "Okay. I'll be here for you."
translation.ko: 전 그 사람을 위해 기다리겠다고 했죠

translation.en: When I got back home, one of my friends Googled the Leviev family.
translation.ko: 집으로 돌아오니 제 친구가 레비예프 가족을 검색해 봤대요

translation.en: She says this is one of the most powerful families.
They've become big for a reason.
Need to be realistic about what he's involved in.
translation.ko: 현실적으로 생각해야 했어요 사이먼이 어떤 일에 발 담갔는지요

translation.en: I hadn't seen him in a while. And of course it made you a bit scared.
translation.ko: 사이먼을 한동안 못 봤는데 그럼 당연히 걱정되잖아요

translation.en: So I check his Tinder to see where he is.
translation.ko: 그래서 어디 있는지 틴더를 확인해 봤죠

translation.en: I see that he's in a different country.
And I also see a couple of his pictures had changed.
My heart just sank, you know, 'cause that means that he's been active.
translation.ko: 심장이 쿵 내려앉았죠 그럼 틴더에서 활동했다는 뜻이잖아요

translation.en: So what's going on?
[Simon] I'm not using Tinder anymore. I deleted the app. I deleted the account.
translation.ko: 이제 틴더는 안 써 앱도, 계정도 삭제했거든

translation.en: He tells me that we're a team and we're together
translation.ko: 사이먼이 우린 한 팀이고 연인 사이니까

translation.en: and that I have nothing to worry about.
There's no one else. Only me.
[Simon] I care about you. I miss you. And everything will be all right, baby.
translation.ko: 당신은 소중해, 보고 싶다 다 괜찮을 거야, 자기야

translation.en: I was sitting by my phone, swiping, swiping.
translation.ko: 전 전화기를 끼고 앉아 스와이프 중이었어요

translation.en: [interviewer] What kind of guy were you hoping for?
An ideal guy. A smart one. And funny. And very impulsive.
translation.ko: 이상적인 남자요 지성과 유머를 겸비해야죠 충동적이면서요

translation.en: I'm a very independent woman. I always have been.
translation.ko: 전 아주 독립적인 여자예요 늘 그랬죠

translation.en: I've done that since the age of 16,
so I don't need a man to take care of me,
but I would appreciate to have a man to share my life.
translation.ko: 다만 동반자로 삼을 남자가 있으면 좋겠죠

translation.en: My Tinder profile was a mix.
It had some pictures with me dressed for work, traveling,
translation.ko: 출근용 복장으로 찍은 사진도 있고 여행 사진도 있었어요

translation.en: because I still wanted to attract this person
that was living the same life as I did.
So I was swiping. And then this guy comes up.
This is someone who is well-traveled.
And still works very hard.
So I thought, "Oh, great. Let's swipe right on that."
I got a match.
He was here in Stockholm for business, but it said he was living in Amsterdam.
He texts me and asks me if I want to come visit.
translation.ko: 그 남자가 놀러 오겠냐며 문자를 보냈어요

translation.en: [Simon] There is a flight tomorrow at nine o'clock in the morning
from Stockholm to Amsterdam.
So tell me if it's all right for you.
He asked about my passport details, booked my flight ticket,
translation.ko: 제 여권 정보를 묻고 비행기 표도 예약해 주길래

translation.en: which I thought was a nice gesture.
I get this confirmation from Simon Leviev at LLD Diamonds.
translation.ko: 확정된 예약자 이름을 보니 LLD 다이아몬드의 사이먼 레비예프래요

translation.en: Of course, I started to Google,
because you always Google everyone you're supposed to go on a date with.
translation.ko: 물론 데이트 상대는 무조건 검색해 보잖아요

translation.en: His father is this diamond tycoon,
and I'm just thinking, "Oh my God, another diamond guy."
-Um… -[interviewer] Another diamond guy? Yeah.
I used to date a guy that was in the diamond industry.
translation.ko: 다이아몬드 업계 종사자랑 사귄 적 있는데

translation.en: Okay, maybe second time around.
I take a car to his house, which is in this lovely, lovely neighborhood.
translation.ko: 차 타고 사이먼 집으로 갔는데 동네가 참 멋지더라고요

translation.en: He comes and opens up the door.
He dresses very elegantly.
"A little bit short for my taste," was the first thing I was thinking,
translation.ko: 제 취향이라기엔 키가 작다는 생각부터 했죠

translation.en: but he's really easy to talk to.
It's quite rare that you meet someone and you have this instant connection.
After we spent an hour together,
we felt like we had known each other for ten years or something.
We go for lunch, the entire staff welcomes us.
translation.ko: 점심 먹으러 갔을 땐 전 직원이 반겨 줬어요

translation.en: They bring a special order of caviar that the restaurant uses just for Simon.
I don't think the food ever stopped coming in.
He really asked a lot of questions, really wanted to listen,
translation.ko: 사이먼은 질문이 많았고 제 말에 귀 기울였는데

translation.en: which I really appreciated.
'Cause it's quite rare to have men listen sometimes.
translation.ko: 얘기를 들어 주는 남자는 흔치 않잖아요

translation.en: Afterwards, we had a nice, long walk around Amsterdam. I see a diamond museum.
translation.ko: 식사 후엔 암스테르담을 한참 거닐었는데 다이아몬드 박물관이 보였죠

translation.en: I love museums, and if you should go to a diamond museum,
translation.ko: 전 박물관이 좋은데 다이아몬드 박물관에 가야 한다면

translation.en: you should go with someone in the business.
He knows all about the mines,
how to cut them, where you get the best diamonds.
He knows everything.
After that, he makes this little bit of a move on me.
translation.ko: 그러고 나서 저한테 슬쩍 작업을 걸더군요

translation.en: But it just doesn't feel right.
He's like, "No, maybe no. Just… Better just stay friends."
"Yeah, maybe you're right." [laughs]
Even though there wasn't a romantic energy between us,
I really enjoyed myself.
I actually missed him after just a day or two, because we did have a lot of fun.
translation.ko: 하루 이틀 만에 사이먼이 보고 싶더라고요 우린 참 즐거웠거든요

translation.en: We were talking and calling and texting.
When he's out to dinner,
he sends me a picture, and we used voice notes.
translation.ko: 사이먼은 저녁에 외식하면 사진을 보냈고 우린 음성 메시지도 나눴죠

translation.en: [Simon] Beautiful looking. Beautiful, Pernilla.
Happy to see you tomorrow.
You can be two different types of personalities sometimes.
translation.ko: 사람은 때에 따라 두 가지 모습이 있어서

translation.en: So either you can be a battery charger or a battery drainer.
[Simon] Work hard, play hard.
And he was definitely my battery charger.
translation.ko: 사이먼은 확실히 제 기운을 북돋워 줬죠

translation.en: [Simon] Amazing. Amazing. Beautiful dress.
Once, I remember, like, he flew over just to have a coffee with me one day
translation.ko: 한번은 저랑 커피나 마시겠다며 비행기로 날아왔어요

translation.en: because I was having a bad day.
[Simon] Pernilla, about 10 o'clock we're going for a drink.
Then, 12:30, we're going to the club.
[Pernilla] Can't wait to see you later!
I gave him a little bit of a prince emoji next to his name,
translation.ko: 사이먼 이름 옆에 왕자 이모티콘을 붙였어요

translation.en: because that's how he's behaving sometimes.
And I always make a joke about this.
Really felt like we had a special connection.
[Simon] I can't wait to see you.
I love you with all my heart. I miss you so much.
[Cecilie] Simon was away a lot on business.
We'd talk and text every single day.
Your girl is finally done with yoga for the night.
And she's at home making some delicious salmon.
translation.ko: 지금은 집에서 맛난 연어를 굽고 있어

translation.en: I felt special.
It was just amazing.
And then, he asked me.
It's just the best feeling, you know, when you have someone
translation.ko: 그런 행복이 또 없죠 연인끼리 마음이 잘 통할 때요

translation.en: and both are on the same wavelength.
Time for apartment number two.
Living room where we can watch movies and stuff.
translation.ko: 이 거실에선 영화 같은 걸 보는 거야

translation.en: I was dreaming of how it would be for the two of us to live together.
translation.ko: 전 우리가 함께 사는 모습을 꿈꿨죠

translation.en: And then you have this awesome kitchen.
And here is the bedroom.
Simon tells me that the budget is $15,000 per month.
Third apartment.
So I'm going all the rounds in these amazing apartments.
And sometimes I even have Simon with me on FaceTime.
It was just a really nice way to connect with him,
even though he wasn't there, to do it together.
translation.ko: 제 곁엔 없었지만 그 과정을 함께했으니까요

translation.en: The view is out to the Piazza at Covent Garden.
Cecilie, my love, I love you, I miss you. I can't wait to see you.
translation.ko: 세실리에, 사랑해 보고 싶다, 얼른 만나자

translation.en: In the middle of the night, I get a picture of Peter, Simon's bodyguard.
translation.ko: 한밤중에 사이먼의 경호원인 피터 사진을 받았어요

translation.en: Simon is writing "Peter hurt," and I'm like, "What the fuck?"
translation.ko: 피터가 다쳤다는 문자에 저도 난리가 났죠

translation.en: Well, this is the night.
[woman] Can you write your first name? Or I can write it, of course.
translation.ko: 성함 쓰실 수 있나요? 제가 써 드려요?

translation.en: We're in an ambulance.
[woman] Can you write that?
He just says that, "They were going after me. Thank God for Peter."
translation.ko: 놈들이 자기를 노린다며 피터가 있어서 다행이랬죠

translation.en: "If not, I would be dead."
[Simon] It's okay, love. It's okay.
I told you, we're in a war. We need to be strong.
translation.ko: 괜찮아, 자기야 지금 전쟁 중이랬잖아 우린 강해져야 해

translation.en: I didn't know what to do. And he just says, "We're safe now."
"We're being taken care of. You just need to sleep."
The next morning, Simon sends me a voice note.
translation.ko: 다음 날 아침 사이먼이 음성 메시지를 보냈죠

translation.en: [Simon] Because of the situation, with the security and everything,
they told me I'm not allowed to use my credit card.
translation.ko: 내 신용 카드는 쓰면 안 된대

translation.en: He can't use his cards anymore because the security team has said his enemies
translation.ko: 자기 카드는 못 쓴다더군요 경호 팀에서 경고하길 적들이

translation.en: are tracing his spending and where he is based on his credit card use.
translation.ko: 신용 카드 결제 내역으로 자길 추적한다면서요

translation.en: [Simon] I wanted to ask you a favor.
If you have an American Express credit card,
translation.ko: 혹시 아메리칸 익스프레스 신용 카드가 있다면

translation.en: I can link it to my account.
He was just wondering if he could use my cards for some time.
translation.ko: 당분간 제 카드를 써도 되냐고 묻던데

translation.en: It would just help him a lot.
[Simon] It's just temporary, like, for, uh,
two weeks or something.
[Cecilie] I'm his girlfriend.
Of course he would ask me. Like, you trust me and I trust you,
translation.ko: 당연히 저한테 부탁하겠죠 서로를 신뢰하는 만큼 돕는 게 당연하니까

translation.en: so of course we're gonna help each other. It wasn't even a question.
translation.ko: 서로를 신뢰하는 만큼 돕는 게 당연하니까 고민할 여지도 없었어요

translation.en: The Platinum Amex is in my name, and he starts using it as he said he would,
translation.ko: 제 명의로 된 플래티넘 아멕스 카드를 사이먼이 쓰기 시작했는데

translation.en: but he maxes out quite quickly.
So he makes payment directly to Amex, and I get the receipt from him,
translation.ko: 카드 대금은 사이먼이 결제하고 영수증을 보내 줬는데

translation.en: and he says that the money is on the way, but in the meantime,
translation.ko: 곧 돈이 융통된다면서 기다리는 동안 저더러 암스테르담으로

translation.en: he wants me to come to Amsterdam and bring some cash to him. $25,000.
translation.ko: 기다리는 동안 저더러 암스테르담으로 현금 2만 5천 달러를 가져오랬죠

translation.en: How on Earth am I going to get that amount of cash?
I took out a loan, which I then took out in cash.
translation.ko: 전 대출을 받았고 그 돈을 인출했어요

translation.en: I was super scared having that amount of cash in my bag.
translation.ko: 가방에 그런 거금이 있으니 너무 무섭더라고요

translation.en: Especially when we went through security.
I was super stressed.
How was I gonna explain the money if I got any questions about it?
translation.ko: 누가 캐물으면 그 돈을 어떻게 설명하죠?

translation.en: The moment I'm with him, I feel safe. My biggest issue was being apart from him.
translation.ko: 사이먼 곁에선 안심이었지만 떨어져 있을 때가 문제였어요

translation.en: He was really grateful.
He told me that everything I was doing is keeping him safe.
translation.ko: 제 모든 행동이 자기를 지키는 거랬죠

translation.en: But within hours, the security team said there was a problem.
translation.ko: 몇 시간 후에 경호 팀에서 문제가 있다더군요

translation.en: He deletes his Instagram because of security measures,
translation.ko: 사이먼은 보안 문제로 인스타그램 계정을 삭제했고

translation.en: and then he asked me to make my account private.
Take it all away.
He says that they can come and get me through him.
translation.ko: 놈들이 자기를 통해 저까지 해칠 수 있다면서요

translation.en: Of course, I get paranoid. What the fuck is going on?
translation.ko: 전 편집증이 도졌죠 대체 무슨 일일까요?

translation.en: Later on, Simon gets a call.
He puts Peter on the speakerphone, and he says,
"Simon, there's been a security breach. They know where you are."
"The plane is ready to leave. I can't tell you where you're going."
translation.ko: '비행기를 준비해 뒀는데 행선지는 말씀 못 드립니다'

translation.en: Peter is asking if he can please turn off the lights in the apartment.
translation.ko: 피터가 아파트 조명을 다 끄라고 했어요

translation.en: I'm shit scared. Are they coming now? Did we lock the door?
[voice breaking] Just seeing someone that you care so much for in danger,
and, like, you can see that he was not doing well mentally.
I could see that he was struggling so much.
And in the end, he just told me that he had to go.
When he lands, he sends me the geotag. He's landed in Stockholm.
translation.ko: 비행 후에 위치 정보를 보내 주던데 스톡홀름에 착륙했더군요

translation.en: He is here. Very spontaneous.
So I ask him…
The club is basically an ocean with women,
or as I call them, champagne girls.
They are basically like flies. Like, you put out a rotten banana, and they just attack,
translation.ko: 썩은 바나나를 보면 달려드는 파리 떼처럼

translation.en: but these girls do the same thing when they see a bottle of champagne.
translation.ko: 그 여자들은 샴페인만 보면 득달같이 달라붙죠

translation.en: And Simon is of course paying for this entire circus.
translation.ko: 물론 그 놀음판엔 사이먼이 돈을 댔어요

translation.en: He's paying with cash and just making sure that everyone is having a good time.
translation.ko: 현금으로 계산하며 모두가 즐기게 해 줬죠

translation.en: All of them are quite drunk, especially Simon's bodyguard, Peter.
translation.ko: 다들 만취했는데 사이먼의 경호원 피터가 특히 심했어요

translation.en: This is not an environment that I want to be in.
So I just stay for 10, 15 minutes and then just say,
"Let's talk tomorrow and enjoy your night and have fun."
The morning after, I text him and ask how the hangover is
translation.ko: 다음 날 아침 문자로 숙취가 어떤지 물으면서

translation.en: and maybe if he needs a cup of coffee, we should go for one,
and then he texts me back.
He's already in Spain.
The Amex card is in my name.
[automated voice] Welcome to American Express.
So I had to pretend that I was the one traveling around, you know.
translation.ko: 그래서 제가 여행 중인 척해야 했죠

translation.en: I understand your card isn't working.
I'll connect you with someone who can assist. Say or enter…
translation.ko: 담당 직원을 연결해 드리죠 음성이나 버튼으로…

translation.en: I needed to know exactly the amount that he was spending, which hotel he was in,
translation.ko: 사이먼이 얼마를 쓰는지 알아야 했어요 어느 호텔에 묵는지도요

translation.en: so they would believe that I was the one using the card.
translation.ko: 그래야 카드사에서 제가 결제하는 건 줄 알죠

translation.en: [Simon] We need to go. We need to travel.
It's making things very complicated, honey.
Couple of hours later he would call again, and it's blocked again.
translation.ko: 몇 시간 후에 사이먼이 카드가 또 막혔다며 전화했죠

translation.en: [automated voice] Welcome to American Express.
[Cecilie] Then I need to call Amex,
and Simon had already told me that this would happen,
translation.ko: 사이먼은 애초에 이렇게 될 거라고 했어요

translation.en: that it would be something that I would need to do at the start to call them and fix this.
translation.ko: 이런 문제는 제가 연락해서 해결해야 한댔죠

translation.en: The other problem was that the credit limit wasn't enough.
We had to get it up so he could spend it, 'cause he had an entire team, you know.
translation.ko: 사이먼이 돈을 쓰려면 한도를 올려야 했죠 팀원들도 챙겨야 하니까요

translation.en: So I was like, "Okay, but how are you going to do that?"
He said, "Well, I can employ you."
He then calls someone in LLD Diamonds and asks for my passport details,
translation.ko: 사이먼은 LLD 다이아몬드 직원한테 연락했고 저한텐 여권 정보를 물었죠

translation.en: so I can be put into the employment registry.
I just tried to say, "Well, I am not really working there."
translation.ko: 그래도 전 진짜 직원이 아니라고 했더니

translation.en: He's like, "Well, you are. I'm the CEO. If they call, you are employed."
translation.ko: 저도 직원이래요 자기가 CEO니까 카드사에서 연락하면 직원이라고 하랬죠

translation.en: [Simon] I would never ask you for anything if it was not serious shit.
translation.ko: 심각한 문제가 아니었다면 자기한테 부탁 안 했어

translation.en: All these security issues,
you've always been there for me, so thank you, my love.
translation.ko: 언제나 곁을 지켜 줘서 고마워, 자기야

translation.en: We were in a crisis at this point. Like, what else are we gonna do?
translation.ko: 우린 그때 위기였으니 달리 방법이 없잖아요

translation.en: So then I got employed. I got pay slips.
translation.ko: 그래서 전 취직했고 급여 명세서도 받았어요

translation.en: -[interviewer] How much? -Earning so much.
I think it was, like, $94,000 per month.
I send this over to prove that I earn much more.
translation.ko: 카드사에 그 서류를 보내 초과 수입을 증명하니

translation.en: That makes them raise the credit limit like this.
Of course, you are a bit worried,
but he sends me a receipt from Credit Suisse
translation.ko: 근데 사이먼이 크레디트 스위스 영수증을 보내 줬는데

translation.en: where he's making a transfer directly to me.
It's more than enough to pay for the amount that he was spending.
translation.ko: 사이먼이 쓰는 돈을 갚고도 남을 액수였죠

translation.en: [Pernilla] Mykonos is like a perfect playground.
You will see a lot of yachts, a lot of celebrities, a lot of models.
translation.ko: 요트를 잔뜩 볼 수 있거든요 유명인과 모델도 많고요

translation.en: You pack all your bikinis, definitely, for the daytime parties as well.
I am on the phone with Simon,
and he tells me he has just met his new girlfriend.
Polina.
I tell him they should meet us in Mykonos, and he does.
translation.ko: 둘이 미코노스로 와서 우리랑 놀자고 했더니 진짜로 오더군요

translation.en: [Cecilie] I was going to Oslo. To see my friends, see my family.
translation.ko: 전 오슬로로 갔어요 친구들과 가족을 보고

translation.en: And I really wanted to introduce him.
I'm just waiting for him. He said he was gonna come the next day.
translation.ko: 전 사이먼을 기다렸죠 다음 날 온댔거든요

translation.en: [Pernilla] I meet Polina for the first time.
She's this typical, like, Russian model. Quite young. But she's very down to earth.
translation.ko: 전형적인 러시아 모델로 꽤 어리지만 허세가 없어서

translation.en: And I really liked her.
He seems very smitten over her. They seemed like a good match.
translation.ko: 사이먼이 푹 빠진 눈치였고 둘이 잘 어울렸어요

translation.en: [Simon] Look, I cannot come right now. I cannot.
[Cecilie] The security team had told him, "You need to stay away."
I felt deeply disappointed.
But what's most important is actually to keep him safe.
[Pernilla] Of course he had booked the grand suite, with own private pool.
translation.ko: 사이먼은 전용 수영장이 딸린 그랜드 스위트룸을 예약했죠

translation.en: It's about $5,000 a night, this room. It's absolutely gorgeous.
[Simon] I know you hate to ring up the bank, but sometimes it is necessary.
translation.ko: 은행에 전화하긴 싫겠지만 가끔은 어쩔 수 없지

translation.en: I need to book some tickets for the rest of the team.
[Cecilie] Suddenly need to get so much money for this entire team
translation.ko: 갑자기 팀 전체를 운영할 큰돈이 필요하대요

translation.en: that is traveling business class, that is having expensive dinners.
translation.ko: 다들 비즈니스 클래스를 타고 값비싼 저녁을 먹고

translation.en: Like, they're going out with clients, and the spend is to another level
translation.ko: 고객 접대도 하니까요 씀씀이의 차원이 다른데

translation.en: that you have never, ever seen before.
[Simon] This is what I do all the time. Just meetings and more meetings.
$20,000 is a lot of money, and that was spent in three days.
Simon asks, "Where should we go now?"
We decide to go to Bonbonniere, also known as the billionaire's club.
translation.ko: 우리가 찾아간 본보니에르는 억만장자 클럽으로 불리는 곳이죠

translation.en: You don't get in here without paying for a table,
which is normally $2,000.
For people here, this is peanuts for them. This is coffee money.
translation.ko: 거기 다니는 사람들한텐 커피값 수준의 푼돈이죠

translation.en: [Cecilie] He maxes out the credit card again.
So he told me to get more loans.
[Simon] Don't worry, I will finish this deal. Champagne's on me.
translation.ko: 걱정 마, 계약 성사하면 샴페인 쏠게

translation.en: [Pernilla] Simon orders in a couple of bottles of champagne.
Before we even have time to try and chip in,
he has already paid for the bill.
Simon is very generous.
I take out a loan for $40,000.
[Pernilla] Simon and Polina were continuing their little summer tour.
[Simon] I tried to do, like, another transaction, and it didn't go through.
Every second or third day is a new request.
France, and then they were going Vienna. They were going Switzerland.
translation.ko: 프랑스에 이어 비엔나로 떠났고 스위스도 가더라고요

translation.en: [Simon] Almost there. I'm 97% done with the deals.
Each time he maxes out the card, I have to take out a new loan.
translation.ko: 카드 한도를 초과할 때마다 전 대출을 새로 받았어요

translation.en: $50,000 Instabank. $12,500 DNB. $10,000 for a credit card.
translation.ko: 인스타뱅크에서 5만 달러 DNB에서 12,500달러 신용 카드 빚은 1만 달러였죠

translation.en: [Pernilla] "Let's meet up in Rome. We need to go and see the Coliseum."
[Simon] Hello.
[high-pitched] Hello.
[Pernilla] This amazing Rolls-Royce Phantom is taking us around all the famous sites,
translation.ko: 멋진 롤스로이스 팬텀이 우릴 유명 관광지로 이끌었죠

translation.en: like the Spanish Stairs, the Coliseum,
the Trevi Fountain to throw a few pennies.
I definitely need some more luck in my life. Let's see if this can sort it out.
translation.ko: 내 삶엔 행운이 부족한데 도움이 될지 볼까?

translation.en: [Simon, gruffly] Check what is going on with the card.
Now. It's important.
Money he had promised me still hasn't come into my account.
translation.ko: 사이먼이 약속한 돈은 제 계좌로 안 들어왔어요

translation.en: [Simon] I've already done it so it doesn't matter right now.
translation.ko: 난 벌써 송금했다니까 지금 그게 중요해?

translation.en: We need a solution right now for the current situation.
It's kind of like a pressure that I have never experienced before
to have someone's life depending on what you're doing.
[Simon] You know, I'm facing security threats
with people trying to kill me.
If he couldn't use the card, if something went wrong, he could be in danger.
translation.ko: 사이먼이 카드를 못 써서 일이 잘못되면 위험해질 수 있고

translation.en: And if I didn't help him, what might happen?
translation.ko: 제가 안 도와주면 어떻게 될지 모르잖아요

translation.en: Morning.
The things you're doing for me, the things we're going through together,
translation.ko: 당신이 날 도와주며 함께 겪는 일들은

translation.en: it's for life.
This is what is making me see that you are the one.
translation.ko: 덕분에 당신이 내 운명이란 걸 깨달았어

translation.en: $20,000, Monobank. $15,000, Nordea.
[Pernilla] We all give each other a big hug and say that we should meet again soon,
translation.ko: 우린 서로 꼭 안아 주며 곧 다시 뭉치자고 했어요

translation.en: after just like an amazing summer, really.
[interviewer] How much had you taken?
$250,000. That's not what I signed up for.
-[interviewer] A lot. -It is a lot of money.
[Simon] I know you have done, uh, too much,
for me, for us, for everything.
I know you're tired and you want to be together,
which, of course, I do want as well.
I understand. Everything will be all right.
I was getting so tired and annoyed and I just needed some kind of money.
translation.ko: 전 너무 지치고 짜증 난 데다 얼마라도 돈이 필요했어요

translation.en: That's when he says, "You can come to Amsterdam and I can give you a check."
translation.ko: 그때 사이먼이 말했죠 '암스테르담으로 오면 수표 써 줄게'

translation.en: He seemed colder. Wasn't the same kind of affection.
There was almost a cloud across his eyes that I couldn't pierce through.
translation.ko: 그 사람 눈빛에 구름이라도 낀 것처럼 속마음이 보이질 않았죠

translation.en: When we get into the apartment, the check is already there.
translation.ko: 아파트로 가 보니 수표를 준비해 뒀더군요

translation.en: The check is worth much more than the debt I have now.
We're trying to be together. But I can just feel a distance.
translation.ko: 단둘이 시간을 보냈어요 근데 거리감이 느껴졌어요

translation.en: It wasn't a good night.
The first thing I do when I come back from Amsterdam is cash this check.
I really needed that check to go through.
translation.ko: 그 수표를 꼭 현금으로 바꿔야 했어요

translation.en: I had eight, nine creditors, you know.
That's a lot of emails coming down on you at the same time.
I check my bank account every single day.
When four days have passed, I just know that I need to call the bank.
[woman] How can I help you today?
She says, "We won't cash it."
And she couldn't tell me why.
And that's when I was just standing on the phone, like,
feeling that I had hard to breathe.
[Simon] Cecilie, I don't understand. We have…
I was asking about the check, like, "It didn't work."
He says, "Well, fuck it. I gave you the money, so…"
"I did my deal."
[Simon, irately] I already done it.
[Cecilie] Never hear him so cold in my life.
It was like that person on the phone was no longer my boyfriend.
translation.ko: 수화기 너머의 상대는 이제 제 남친이 아니었어요

translation.en: Was no longer my boyfriend.
I… It was just a, uh… just a darkness.
I know I was in deep shit.
Like, what do you do when you have nine creditors on you?
I called the Amex helpline.
They can hear how stressed I am.
They just said, "Stay put. We will come to you."
I was shit scared they were gonna come and handcuff me and take me away.
translation.ko: 수갑 채워서 연행할까 봐 얼마나 무서웠다고요

translation.en: The documents that I sent over.
The lies I told on the phone.
I gave him my card.
I tell them everything.
They said, "Do you have a picture of him?"
That moment when they look at each other and they say that's the guy.
Fuck. Shit. You know?
"What kind of name did he use?" And then I said Simon Leviev.
translation.ko: 그 사람이 쓴 이름을 묻길래 사이먼 레비예프라고 했더니

translation.en: And they said, "Well, that's one of many names that he's been using."
"Many names"?
Who is this guy I've been sharing the same bed with?
translation.ko: 저랑 한 침대에서 지낸 남자는 누구죠?

translation.en: "He's a professional. He does this for a living."
Everything's a lie.
He's not a prince of diamonds. He's not the son of a billionaire.
translation.ko: 다이아몬드 왕자도 아니고 억만장자의 아들도 아니었어요

translation.en: The man I loved was never real.
He faked everything.
[crying] It was horrible, you know.
'Cause I still…
In a sense, I still loved him, you know?
Or the person I thought that he was. Like, you know everything is a lie,
translation.ko: 제가 알던 그 사람을요 다 거짓인 건 알지만

translation.en: but then you still have this fairy tale that's going on, on your phone.
translation.ko: 동화 같은 얘기가 휴대폰에 남아 있으니까요

translation.en: Simon, with still the heart behind it, 'cause I couldn't remove it.
translation.ko: 사이먼 이름 뒤의 하트는 차마 못 뗐어요

translation.en: 'Cause I still wanted him to be true.
I don't understand how someone can be so fucking evil.
translation.ko: 어쩜 인간이 그렇게 사악할 수 있죠?

translation.en: I felt that he knew me.
The minute they're gone, I want to speak to my mom.
She just told me, "You need to get back home to Norway."
"I need you to be with me."
I was going through the messages in the text.
translation.ko: 문자 메시지를 훑어보니 제가 계속 물어봤더군요

translation.en: I was still asking, "When are we going to fix the money?"
translation.ko: 문자 메시지를 훑어보니 제가 계속 물어봤더군요 '돈은 언제 마련해 줄래?'

translation.en: The last messages between the two of us is like, "I'm working on it."
And then I blocked him.
There was nothing else to say.
That's when I remember he has my mom's number.
translation.ko: 그러고 보니 그 사람은 우리 엄마 연락처도 알았죠

translation.en: [Simon] Hey, you blocked me, I don't know what is your reason.
I'm trying to reach you. You don't want to talk anyway.
translation.ko: 대화 좀 하려는데 나랑 말 섞기 싫구나

translation.en: I want to tell you something. Take my advice.
translation.ko: 조언 하나 할 테니 잘 들어

translation.en: Just watch out.
Because with every action there will be a reaction.
[Cecilie] I got super scared.
But my mom got even more scared.
We call the police in Norway, because he knows everything about me.
translation.ko: 노르웨이 경찰에 신고했어요 그 사람은 제 모든 걸 알잖아요

translation.en: He has all my passport details, where I was living, where my mom is living.
translation.ko: 제 여권 정보와 주소부터 엄마 집까지요

translation.en: He's spoken to her on the phone. He knows where I am.
translation.ko: 엄마랑 통화도 했고 제 소재도 알죠

translation.en: But the police didn't seem to care.
I don't know what he is capable of.
translation.ko: 그 사람이 무슨 짓을 할지 모르잖아요

translation.en: I've been on the edge for several days.
I had all these creditors. I had to let them know, each one of them.
translation.ko: 제가 빚진 곳에 일일이 설명해야 했는데

translation.en: It wasn't just two banks. There were, like, nine of them.
translation.ko: 은행이 두 곳도 아니고 아홉 곳이나 됐죠

translation.en: For this kind of loan, the interest is so high, that they would just eat me alive.
translation.ko: 이런 대출은 이자가 워낙 세서 사람을 집어삼키고 말죠

translation.en: I felt that I was just drowning.
It was like someone was just dragging me to the bottom.
I was driving down this road, and I saw a trailer coming towards me,
translation.ko: 차를 모는데 트레일러 한 대가 다가오길래

translation.en: and I was thinking…
[crying] "What if I just take the car over," you know?
And just hit… just hit the trailer, you know? [sobs]
Then at least it's done, you know? And that's when I got scared.
translation.ko: 그럼 다 끝날 테니까요 그때 겁이 났어요

translation.en: That's when I got really scared.
I put myself into a psychiatric ward because I didn't know what to do.
translation.ko: 자진해서 정신 병원에 입원했어요 눈앞이 막막했거든요

translation.en: [Pernilla] I was at home, and I could see the phone started flashing.
I see it's Simon, and he has sent me news articles.
Simon's father is gonna be questioned by the police
in a big diamond smuggling case.
Members of Simon's family have gotten arrested. Russia is involved.
-[line ringing] -I give him a call.
That sounds really scary…
He sounds all over the place.
He says police went in. They have shut down all accounts, all credit cards.
translation.ko: 경찰이 들이닥쳐선 계좌랑 신용 카드를 전부 막았대요

translation.en: One girl in the office literally jumped from the building and killed herself.
translation.ko: 사무실 여직원 하나는 건물에서 뛰어내려 자살했고요 "수사받은 여성 자살 정황"

translation.en: But Simon says he doesn't believe that this lady jumped off a building.
translation.ko: 근데 사이먼은 그 여자가 자살한 게 아니래요

translation.en: He believes that someone went in and threw her out.
[Simon] We don't have the options, you know, the…
And I'm getting so scared. I'm like, "What is really going on?"
translation.ko: 덜컥 겁이 나서 무슨 일이냐고 물었더니

translation.en: And he says that the security situation right now is really bad.
[Simon] I have the worst night in my life.
A few days later, I can feel my phone buzzing.
translation.ko: 며칠 뒤에 제 휴대폰이 울려 댔어요

translation.en: Simon is sending a lot of messages.
Oh, my God, what happened last night?
translation.ko: 맙소사, 간밤에 무슨 일이 있었던 거야?

translation.en: [Simon] Someone tried to stab me, and
so Peter broke his hand.
[Pernilla] Jesus. What do you mean tried to stab you? What is going on?
translation.ko: 세상에, 누가 찌르려고 했다니 대체 무슨 일인데?

translation.en: Simon said, "This is my enemies behind this."
He was really concerned that someone was after him.
And then I get a voice note from him.
[Simon] I want to ask you, uh, a favor.
"Pernilla, I am really embarrassed to even ask you."
"Would it be possible for me to borrow $30,000?"
It would be a huge, huge, huge, huge, huge, huge help.
Please let me know if you can do something. Thank you so much.
translation.ko: 도와줄 수 있으면 말해 줘 정말 고마워

translation.en: I didn't have $30,000 to spare.
I'd been at my mom's now for three months.
I had my savings
that was gonna go to buy myself a new apartment where I'm supposed to live.
But, what is more important,
my friend's security situation or me buying an apartment?
translation.ko: 제 친구의 신변 문제와 새 아파트 중에서요

translation.en: [Simon] Thank you for everything you've done…
[Pernilla] And I make a bank transfer while I'm on the phone with him.
He's really grateful to have such a good friend as me that he really can trust.
translation.ko: 저처럼 믿음직한 친구가 있어서 참 고맙다고 하더군요

translation.en: [Cecilie] I was laying in bed at the psychiatric ward, on my phone,
going through more details with the people that I had met.
translation.ko: 제가 만난 사람들을 더 자세히 살펴봤어요

translation.en: I knew that Simon was lying. But what about the others?
Peter, the bodyguard.
If it wasn't real, then did he lie to me as well?
translation.ko: 다 가짜라면 피터도 절 속인 걸까요?

translation.en: Who is the woman with the kid?
Was that Simon's daughter?
I write a message to Amex.
Can you give me some more information?
They tell me to Google Shimon Hayut and that I will find some answers.
There's an article in Finnish.
So I go into Google Translate.
Israeli multi-millionaire that cheated on women.
What the fuck?
Back in 2015, he had been defrauding three Finnish women.
translation.ko: 2015년엔 핀란드 여성 세 명의 돈을 사취했대요

translation.en: They don't give names. They are protected.
He was saying that he was in the weapons industry to one of the women.
translation.ko: 어느 피해자에겐 자기가 군수 산업 종사자라고 했대요

translation.en: To another woman, he said he was a Mossad agent.
That's insane. He goes to prison. He becomes even worse.
translation.ko: 황당하죠 감옥에 다녀오면서 더 악질이 된 거예요

translation.en: They let out a guy that has almost been, like, cooking up a new plan.
translation.ko: 새로운 수작을 꾸민 놈을 풀어 준 거잖아요

translation.en: You knew he would just continue, continue, continue.
translation.ko: 계속 그런 짓을 할 게 뻔한데 말이죠

translation.en: Who's gonna stop him?
I had to stop him.
I needed to go to the biggest newspaper in Norway, VG.
I was just praying, you know, that they would take this on.
[journalist] This was really like an unbelievable story.
A guy who had pretended to be a son of a diamond billionaire.
translation.ko: 다이아몬드 억만장자의 아들 행세를 한 남자라뇨

translation.en: Private jets, a luxury lifestyle. It, uh, sounds almost like a fairy tale or movie.
translation.ko: 전용기부터 호화로운 생활까지 꼭 동화나 영화 같죠

translation.en: [journalist 2] First thing you ask as a journalist is
what kind of documentation can you share with us?
translation.ko: 공유 가능한 문서 자료를 확인하는 겁니다

translation.en: You can't print it without documentation.
[Cecilie] Of course, I have WhatsApp.
I then imagine strangers reading through my inner thoughts, my fears,
translation.ko: 그걸 보내면 낯선 사람들이 제 생각, 두려움과 사랑이 담긴 메시지를 읽는 건데

translation.en: my love for this guy, you know?
translation.ko: 제 생각, 두려움과 사랑이 담긴 메시지를 읽는 건데

translation.en: It's super private. It's selfies in bed.
translation.ko: 사적인 내용인 데다 잠자리 셀카도 있거든요

translation.en: But the evidence came first, and I just sent it over.
[Natalie] It was almost 400 pages of text.
[Erlend] There's video.
[Natalie] Pictures.
[Simon] Okay, baby. I'm taking off now.
[Natalie] Audio messages.
[Erlend] It's astounding. It's like looking into the anatomy of the relationship.
translation.ko: 놀랍게도 두 사람 관계의 해부도를 보는 듯한데

translation.en: We can follow how this developed minute by minute.
translation.ko: 사건의 흐름을 분 단위로 추적할 수 있죠

translation.en: [Kristoffer] He's extremely professional in what he does.
[Natalie] The first date was a good way to lure her to believe that he was really successful.
translation.ko: 첫 데이트는 자기가 성공했다며 여성을 속이는 수법이죠

translation.en: This is an emotional con.
He was promising so much…
translation.ko: "자기랑 나랑" "그래, 자기야, 영원히" 그자는 많은 걸 약속했죠

translation.en: an apartment together,
vacations,
building a family together.
[Simon] I wanted to ask you a favor.
[Natalie] The first request for money comes after they've been dating for over a month.
translation.ko: 교제한 지 한 달이 지나서 처음으로 돈을 요구하는데

translation.en: And he has been using that month to make her fall in love with him,
translation.ko: 그 한 달간 피해자가 자신을 사랑하게 하고

translation.en: prove that he is really rich, and make her afraid of his enemies.
translation.ko: 자신이 갑부임을 증명하며 피해자도 자기 적들을 두려워하게 만들죠

translation.en: There's no reason to believe that Simon is not able to pay her back,
translation.ko: 사이먼이 돈을 못 갚으리라고 의심할 이유가 없죠

translation.en: because she has seen how wealthy he is.
[Natalie] Simon is surrounded by a lot of people,
especially his bodyguard and his business partner.
We don't know who is working with Simon and how far this conspiracy actually goes.
translation.ko: 사이먼이 누구와 한패인지는 몰라요 이 음모가 어디까지 뻗어 있는지도요

translation.en: Cecilie was also sending us this Finnish article.
Is Shimon Hayut and Simon Leviev the same guy?
[Natalie] We all got in touch with the authorities
and found out the names of the three Finnish women.
translation.ko: 핀란드인 피해자 세 명의 이름을 알아냈어요

translation.en: I ask Cecilie, does she recognize the victims' names?
[Cecilie] I Google these women.
I don't recognize anyone.
And then a face pops up that is very familiar.
It's the same woman that was on the jet with me.
The same woman that has a child with Simon.
How on the fucking Earth were you a victim?
You were standing at the trial back in 2016.
Putting him to jail,
knowing that he had lied to you,
and suddenly, three years later, you're sitting on a private jet with Simon.
translation.ko: 갑자기 3년이 지나선 사이먼과 전용기에 탄 거예요

translation.en: The things that she told me in that car
made me really believe that he was a great guy.
translation.ko: 전 사이먼이 좋은 남자라고 믿게 됐거든요

translation.en: Why didn't she warn me?
[Natalie] That was extraordinary,
and it made it hard because we didn't know who to trust.
translation.ko: 누굴 믿어야 할지 모르니 취재가 힘들었어요

translation.en: But we still had to prove to the police that Shimon Yehuda Hayut and Simon Leviev
translation.ko: 그래도 우린 경찰에 증명해야 했죠 시몬 예후다 하유트와 사이먼 레비예프는

translation.en: was the same person.
In the indictment, we have his date of birth.
[Kristoffer] So when we typed in "Shimon Hayut" in Google,
that didn't give us much, basically nothing.
But there's one thing that Simon Leviev and Shimon Hayut has in common.
translation.ko: 다만 사이먼 레비예프와 시몬 하유트의 공통점이 하나 있죠

translation.en: They're both from Israel.
[Erlend] We needed someone who knew Hebrew and knew the country of Israel.
translation.ko: 히브리어와 이스라엘을 잘 아는 사람이 필요했어요

translation.en: [Natalie] So we contacted this journalist called Uri.
Uri finds out the last known address for Shimon Hayut. We need to go to Israel.
translation.ko: 우리가 시몬 하유트의 마지막 주소지를 확인해 줬으니 이스라엘로 가야 했어요

translation.en: [Kristoffer] We're driving towards the outskirts of the city,
we see more narrow streets,
smaller apartment buildings, and a lot of ultra-Orthodox Jews.
translation.ko: 더 작은 아파트 건물과 수많은 정통파 유대인이 보였죠

translation.en: [Natalie] This was the total opposite
of how he wanted to present his life in social media.
Is it here?
[Uri] So let's park, uh…
-[Uri] I asked him to stay very near. -[Kristoffer] Okay.
[Uri] In case we need to escape.
Uri, Natalie, and I go out.
My job is to be the cameraman that documents everything that happens.
translation.ko: 전 모든 상황을 기록하는 카메라맨 역을 맡았죠

translation.en: That's the name.
That's the name. This one.
translation.ko: - 여기 이름이 있네요 - 이 이름이죠 여기요

translation.en: What's it says?
It's a letter for him.
-For Shimon? -Shimon Hayut.
Yeah, this one.
So he might actually be staying here.
So this is a letter from the authorities
that ask money back from people when you owe money.
Oh, okay.
[in Hebrew] Hello.
Who are you?
We're journalists.
We're looking for Simon.
[woman] Who is it?
-You are not allowed to be here. -[woman] But, Mom, come in.
translation.ko: - 여긴 오시면 안 돼요 - 엄마, 들어오세요!

translation.en: So, you're Simon's mother.
-Where is he? -Where is he?
translation.ko: - 사이먼은 어디 있죠? - 내가 묻고 싶네요

translation.en: You're looking for him, I'm looking for him.
He's swindled a woman in Norway for a quarter of a million dollars.
translation.ko: 아드님이 어느 노르웨이 여성한테 25만 달러를 뜯었답니다

translation.en: I have absolutely no contact with him. I have nothing to do with him.
translation.ko: 걔랑 연락이 뚝 끊겼고 연도 끊었거든요

translation.en: I've not had contact with him since he was 18 years old.
-But his registered address is here. -He changed his name and address.
He is not Hayut anymore.
-So who is he? -Leviev.
[in English] Let's go.
[Natalie] To confirm that Simon and Shimon was the same person,
we need to see the local police.
Is this face familiar to you?
[in Hebrew] Yes.
In 2017, he changed his name to Simon Leviev.
Before that, he was known as Shimon Hayut.
[Kristoffer in English] The police confirmed that Simon Leviev and Shimon Hayut
translation.ko: 경찰이 확인해 줬는데 사이먼 레비예프와 시몬 하유트는

translation.en: is the same guy convicted in Finland.
translation.ko: 핀란드에서 유죄 판결을 받은 그 남자였어요

translation.en: He uses many names.
He has been a fraudster since his late teens.
You start to piece together some more of the puzzle.
translation.ko: 더 많은 퍼즐 조각이 맞춰지기 시작했어요

translation.en: Back in 2011, Simon was suspected of stealing a check from his employer.
translation.ko: 2011년에 사이먼은 직원의 수표를 훔쳤다는 의혹을 받았습니다

translation.en: He moves on to other stolen checks and forged checks.
translation.ko: 이어서 더 많은 도난 수표와 위조 수표에 손댔죠

translation.en: Simon was supposed to meet in court, but he fled the country.
translation.ko: 사이먼은 법정에 출두하기로 했는데 해외로 도주했어요

translation.en: [policewoman in Hebrew] But then he left Israel. He forged a passport and left the country.
translation.ko: 그자는 이스라엘을 떠났어요 위조 여권으로 출국했죠

translation.en: [Natalie in English] So he's wanted by the police?
[in Hebrew] Yes.
The Israeli authorities demand that he be found
so the trial against him can continue.
And we're doing what we can to find him and bring him in.
[Natalie in English] We got a lot of new and really good information after the trip to Israel,
translation.ko: 이스라엘에서 중요한 새 정보를 다수 확보했는데요

translation.en: but we don't know where he is right now.
Well, I will keep you posted.
Everybody else got their money, so you should too.
I will see what's going on. I will call the bank.
Love you. Miss you. Bye-bye.
He really apologizes and says that he needs to borrow a little bit more.
translation.ko: 진심으로 사과하면서 하는 말이 돈을 좀 더 빌려야겠다길래

translation.en: I told him, "Simon, you were supposed to transfer back this money you borrowed a week or two after."
"Are you sure everything is gonna be okay?"
He's like, "Yeah, everything is gonna be okay."
So I transfer him another $10,000.
[Simon] I guarantee you I will make payment next week.
[Pernilla] The next week, he texts me a bank receipt for $100,000.
translation.ko: 그다음 주엔 문자로 10만 달러짜리 은행 영수증을 보내더군요

translation.en: Simon is being very generous. He only owes me 40,000.
translation.ko: 사이먼이 통 크게 굴었죠 저한테 빌린 건 4만 달러인걸요

translation.en: Oh, seriously, Simon, that is so nice of you.
Thank you. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you so, so much.
Kisses.
[Simon] Through the most difficult moments, you have been there for me.
translation.ko: 가장 힘든 순간에 내 곁을 지켜 줬잖아

translation.en: So that's why I wanted to thank you from the bottom of my heart.
And then the money just don't arrive.
[Simon] Unfortunately, the bank want me there physically
with my lawyer to sign some few other papers.
I need to fly and I need to fix it up. I want to ask you a favor.
translation.ko: 비행기로 날아가서 해결해야겠어 부탁 하나만 하자

translation.en: So I pay for these flights on my American Express card.
translation.ko: 제 아메리칸 익스프레스 카드로 그 비행기 표를 샀어요

translation.en: [Simon] The money has left our bank account
so you have nothing to worry about.
[Pernilla] He asked me to help him with another flight.
And then another flight, and then another flight.
[sighs] So with time just passing, money doesn't come in.
translation.ko: 그렇게 시간만 흐르고 돈은 안 들어왔죠

translation.en: [crying] I was just at the bank and they can't find any transfer.
And that I need to pay my bills. I'm really freaking out.
translation.ko: 공과금 내야 하는데 미치고 팔짝 뛰겠어

translation.en: I'm panicking. Like, I got myself in so, so much trouble right now.
translation.ko: 공과금 내야 하는데 미치고 팔짝 뛰겠어 내가 큰일을 저질러 버렸네

translation.en: [Simon] They put a stop on my account.
Of course I can give you one of my watches.
I have a watch worth over 100K.
So he tells me he will book me a flight to wherever he is
translation.ko: 자기가 있는 곳으로 비행기 표를 끊어 줄 테니

translation.en: within a couple of days to collect the watch.
We have a lot of new information, but we still haven't found him.
translation.ko: 새로운 정보는 많았지만 그자는 아직 못 찾았으니

translation.en: So what we have to do is go back into the documentation we got from Cecilie.
Cecilie gave us a lot of transactions done with her Amex card.
translation.ko: 세실리에가 아멕스 카드 거래 내역을 보내 줬거든요

translation.en: In these transactions, we see flight tickets.
translation.ko: 그 거래 내역을 보니 비행기 표를 결제했더군요

translation.en: There are also names.
[Natalie] The business partner.
The bodyguard.
But we could also find names of different women.
[Erlend] So one of the names is Pernilla Sjoholm.
So I find Pernilla on Facebook and write a message to her.
I… panic.
I thought I was gonna pass out.
I forward the message straight over to Simon.
[Simon] I would not…
[Pernilla] He says I shouldn't worry,
that this is his enemies trying to get information.
He really tries to calm me down and even just, like, after hanging up the phone,
translation.ko: 절 달래려고 애쓰던데 전화를 끊고 나니

translation.en: I'm starting to realize, like, this can't be made up.
My phone rings. It is Erlend.
So I asked her, "Can I come to Stockholm to meet you to talk through your story?"
translation.ko: 제가 스톡홀름으로 가서 대화할 수 있을지 물어봤죠

translation.en: I get on a plane. We were meeting up the next day.
translation.ko: 전 비행기에 올랐고 우린 다음 날 만났어요

translation.en: [Pernilla] He tells me everything.
I am furious. Why would Simon do this to me?
translation.ko: 화가 치밀어 올랐어요 사이먼이 왜 그랬을까요?

translation.en: This was a friend who I really cared about, who I loved.
He really created this person that I would like,
translation.ko: 사이먼은 제가 좋아할 만한 캐릭터를 만든 거죠

translation.en: someone who would be a really good friend.
So, if it's not only through romantic relationships that he's pursuing scams,
translation.ko: 그자가 이성 관계만을 이용해 사기 치는 게 아니라면

translation.en: what else could there be?
[Pernilla] I tell Erlend about all the travels
translation.ko: 엘렌드한테 털어놨어요 그간의 여행, 사이먼의 지출과

translation.en: and the amount of money he has been spending,
and all the other people that I have met.
When he tells me about this Norwegian girl,
I'm starting to realize that the amount of money she has lost
translation.ko: 그제야 깨달았죠 그 여자가 날린 액수로는

translation.en: doesn't add up to the lifestyle that he's been living,
because there is an extreme amount of money that has been spent.
This must just be the tip of the iceberg.
After looking at Pernilla's bank accounts, I realize this may be a Ponzi scheme.
translation.ko: 페르닐라의 은행 계좌를 보니 폰지 사기 같더군요

translation.en: He uses Cecilie's money on Pernilla,
and he uses Pernilla's money on somebody else.
It's never his name on the credit card, so he has plausible excuse.
translation.ko: 자기 명의로 된 신용 카드는 아니니까 그럴듯한 핑계를 대는데

translation.en: He can always say, "I was just borrowing the money."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말하면 그만이죠 '돈 좀 빌린 거야'

translation.en: It's almost like the perfect scam.
[Erlend] Of course, by using one woman's credit card
to buy plane tickets to a second woman and to buy a dinner to a third,
translation.ko: 두 번째 여성의 비행기 표와 세 번째 여성의 저녁을 사니까

translation.en: he was able to travel a lot, and he never stayed long in one place.
translation.ko: 그자는 여행이 잦고 한곳에 오래 머물진 않았죠

translation.en: That made it very hard for local police authorities with low budgets
to go after a man that, in their world, was like a small scam.
translation.ko: 그들 기준의 소액 사기를 수사하긴 힘들었던 겁니다

translation.en: Hey, we order all the menu.
I ask Pernilla, "Can you tell me where he is?"
[Pernilla] I don't just only know where he is.
translation.ko: 전 사이먼의 소재를 알 뿐만 아니라

translation.en: I am booked on a flight to go and see him tomorrow.
translation.ko: 다음 날 만나러 가려고 비행기 표도 준비했었죠

translation.en: He's in Munich.
In less than 10 hours, we need to be in Munich.
[Natalie] Our goal in Munich was to film him
to prove to the police that he was possible to find.
translation.ko: 그자를 찾을 수 있다는 걸 경찰에 증명하는 거였죠

translation.en: You're really focused.
You know you have this one chance to get what you want.
Also you have responsibility for Pernilla.
Simon can absolutely not find out that they are there or that I have done this,
translation.ko: 사이먼한테 들켜선 안 됐어요 기자들이 숨어 있고 제가 함정을 팠다는 걸요

translation.en: because I don't know if it's dangerous for me
if he does find out that I'm doing this behind his back.
I'm going in there trying to sabotage his fabulous life.
translation.ko: 전 사이먼의 끝내주는 삶을 짓밟으러 출동했죠

translation.en: The plan is to keep a safe distance,
and to do that, Natalie is tracking Pernilla's whereabouts on the iPhone.
translation.ko: 우린 안전 거리를 유지하기로 했으니 나탈리가 아이폰으로 페르닐라의 소재를 추적했죠

translation.en: [Natalie] In case Simon should look at Pernilla's phone,
Pernilla saves my number as a different name.
translation.ko: 페르닐라는 제 번호를 다른 이름으로 저장했어요

translation.en: That makes it possible for Pernilla to have constant contact with me.
translation.ko: 덕분에 페르닐라는 저랑 계속 연락할 수 있었죠

translation.en: [in Norwegian] She writes that she's just landed.
We have a photographer outside the airport who may be able to get pictures.
translation.ko: 공항 밖에 있는 사진사가 촬영할 수도 있겠네요

translation.en: She writes, "My friend is picking me up."
That must be Simon.
I've now received a picture from the photographer.
Wow, he's in Munich.
[in English] My heart is pounding.
This is the first time I meet his business partner, Avishay,
that he had told me so much about.
I'm starting to become very, very paranoid
because who am I in the car with? Who are they really?
translation.ko: 같은 차에 탄 사람들이 누군지 알 길이 없으니까요

translation.en: I'm looking at him, and I know the truth, like everything that he has done.
translation.ko: 사이먼을 쳐다보는데 전 진실을 알잖아요 무슨 잘못을 저질렀는지요

translation.en: These former feelings that I had that this was my friend just got erased.
translation.ko: 사이먼을 친구로 여겼던 옛 감정은 사라졌어요

translation.en: I don't think I ever hated a person my entire life
until that second when I was sitting in that car and just looking at him.
translation.ko: 그 차에서 사이먼을 봤을 때가 처음이었던 것 같아요

translation.en: [Natalie] Pernilla texted me
that they were going to Mandarin Oriental Hotel.
translation.ko: 페르닐라가 문자로 알려 준 행선지는 만다린 오리엔탈 호텔로

translation.en: That's a fancy hotel with a restaurant inside.
translation.ko: 내부에 레스토랑이 딸린 고급 호텔이었죠 "뮌헨 만다린 오리엔탈"

translation.en: Okay.
The most important job I had in there
was to text Kristoffer and the still photographer
whenever they were leaving the restaurant.
translation.ko: 두 사람이 식당에서 나설 때를 알려 주는 거였죠

translation.en: [Kristoffer] Opposite, there's a parking garage.
Just behind gaps in the wall,
we can place our lenses to capture Simon as he walks out.
translation.ko: 우린 벽 틈에 렌즈를 설치해서 밖으로 나오는 사이먼을 찍기로 했어요

translation.en: Everyone knew about him. "Welcome back, Mr. Leviev."
translation.ko: 다들 사이먼을 알더라고요 '또 오셨군요, 레비예프 씨'

translation.en: And that gets me going.
What have you been doing in Munich? How many victims are here?
translation.ko: '뮌헨에선 무슨 짓을 했어?' '여긴 피해자가 몇 명이야?'

translation.en: He tells me he's sorry about the situation with the money
and he gives me the watch.
He orders everything on the menu,
and I feel so bad even sitting there when we're having this dinner,
translation.ko: 거기서 저녁 먹는 것조차 죄책감이 들었어요

translation.en: 'cause the only thing that goes in my head is,
"Who's paying for this dinner?"
We're just waiting and waiting for a text from Natalie.
Simon looks in our direction, and we hide.
translation.ko: 사이먼이 우리 쪽을 보길래 얼른 숨었죠

translation.en: Simon starts speaking in Hebrew and getting very upset to Avishay.
And I'm like, "What's going on?"
translation.ko: 왜 그러냐고 했더니 두 사람이 말했죠

translation.en: And they were like, "There's a camera guy over there."
translation.ko: 왜 그러냐고 했더니 두 사람이 말했죠 '저쪽에 카메라맨이 있어'

translation.en: And he started screaming, like, "Get into the car!"
Driving around so fast through Munich.
I don't know what they're saying. Do they know that I have set them up to do this?
translation.ko: 말을 못 알아듣겠던데 제가 판 함정이란 걸 들켰을까요?

translation.en: What are they really gonna do with me?
Just think, like, "Pernilla, you play your biggest act you have ever done
translation.ko: 속으로 다짐했죠 '페르닐라, 지금부터' '일생일대의 연기를 펼쳐야 해'

translation.en: your entire life, because otherwise you are never coming home."
translation.ko: '일생일대의 연기를 펼쳐야 해' '안 그럼 집엔 못 가'

translation.en: I'm trying to twist everything around.
I'm screaming at him, like, "Is this your enemies? Are they after me now, Simon?"
He's trying to calm down the situation, like, "No, it's me they're after."
translation.ko: 사이먼은 절 달래려 했죠 '아니, 자기 말고 날 노리는 거야'

translation.en: I'm telling him, "Just drop me off."
I never opened a car door as fast in my entire life.
translation.ko: 차 문을 그렇게 빨리 연 건 난생처음이었죠

translation.en: [Kristoffer] We were very concerned about Pernilla.
We realized we wouldn't be able to confront him there.
translation.ko: 거기서 사이먼 앞에 나타날 순 없었으니까요

translation.en: We need to go back to Oslo and work out our next step.
translation.ko: 오슬로로 돌아가서 다음 작전을 세워야 했죠

translation.en: [Pernilla] I take the watch to a pawn shop, and they tell me it is fake.
Of course it is, because nothing about him is real.
translation.ko: 그럼 그렇죠 그 인간은 다 가짜니까요

translation.en: I really want to confront him and at least tell me the truth.
translation.ko: 그 사람한테 따져 묻고 진실을 듣고 싶어요

translation.en: That's what you want from all people. Just tell me the truth, how it is.
[Natalie] Pernilla really wants to talk to him,
and we are filming that call.
Hello.
Hey, what's up? Good morning. Morning.
Good afternoon. Sorry.
It's okay. What are you doing?
translation.ko: - 벌써 낮인데, 미안 - 괜찮아 뭐 해?

translation.en: I'm all right, and you?
I'm not so good, Simon.
What is it?
Can you just tell me the truth?
I told you the truth. No, you haven't told me the truth.
Can you give me the entire truth? At least I deserve that.
translation.ko: 있는 그대로 말해 줘 그쯤은 해 줘야지

translation.en: I told you the entire truth, I don't understand what is the--
Simon. Simon, I lost everything I have.
Can you please tell me the truth for once. It's a little--
translation.ko: 한 번이라도 솔직하게 말하면 안 돼?

translation.en: Pernilla, you have no idea. My enemies are trying to--
translation.ko: 페르닐라, 자기는 아무것도 몰라 내 적들이…

translation.en: Simon! Simon! Simon! Simon, listen to me. I know.
What do you know? I know about--
Something that I don't know?
What do you know?
I know everything. Simon, I know--
I know you're doing this fraud thing. I know you've been in jail in Finland.
translation.ko: 자기가 사기 치는 것도 알고 핀란드에서 수감된 것도 알아

translation.en: I know you're-- What the fuck is this bullshit?
I know about the other people that you have frauded.
You double-cross me…
I can tell you right now,
you will pay for this for the rest of your life.
I am paying for the rest of my life. You took everything I have.
translation.ko: 안 그래도 평생 고생하겠지 자기가 다 뺏어 갔잖아

translation.en: This is your mistake. If you want to make some claims against me,
translation.ko: 실수하는 거야 그딴 식으로 사람 잡을 거면

translation.en: give me the evidence you have against me.
The Israeli police have confirmed you with your picture.
translation.ko: 이스라엘 경찰이 당신 사진을 확인해 줬어

translation.en: Nobody has confirmed anything. That's not true. Yes.
I had a flight to Amsterdam, right?
Yeah. Yeah, who paid for that?
I paid for it! No, you didn't.
I have the transaction for the ticket, and it's paid by another woman. [sniffles]
translation.ko: 티켓 거래 명세서를 보니 어떤 여자가 냈던데

translation.en: Because of my enemies I couldn't use my own…
translation.ko: 적들 때문에 내 카드는 못 쓰잖아

translation.en: I have paid these people in cash.
I did give them money.
Simon, you can't keep doing this.
Like, it's crazy.
Honey, what have you done this all for?
There will be a price, and I promise it'll be bigger than money.
translation.ko: 대가를 치르게 될 텐데 돈으론 어림도 없어

translation.en: What do you mean, the price?
You double-cross me, you're gonna pay for it.
[Pernilla] I really got scared, because what have I done?
translation.ko: 너무 무서웠어요 제가 무슨 짓을 한 거죠?

translation.en: The only thing that we can do is to make the VG piece as big as possible
to get his face out there,
because if people would know who he is and recognize his face,
he can't do this anymore.
Coming forward with a story like this takes a lot of courage.
translation.ko: 이런 이야기를 제보하려면 큰 용기가 필요하죠

translation.en: I was feeling anxious, you know. VG is the biggest newspaper in Norway.
translation.ko: 전 불안했어요 'VG'는 노르웨이에서 가장 큰 신문인데

translation.en: Like, my face would be on the front cover.
There would be this big online special.
I know that people were gonna judge me. Am I ready?
translation.ko: 다들 절 손가락질할 텐데 감당할 수 있을까요?

translation.en: Your entire life is never gonna be the same again.
Everything just, like, went wildfire. It felt like a nightmare.
translation.ko: 모든 게 산불처럼 번졌는데 악몽 같았죠

translation.en: Social media is brutal, you know. They'll eat you alive.
People are saying what a gold digger you are or, "She deserved this."
translation.ko: 다들 꽃뱀이라고 욕하거나 제가 자초한 일이라는데

translation.en: [Pernilla crying] A gold digger would never give out a penny.
I never understood this, how you can blame a victim.
translation.ko: 어쩜 피해자를 탓하는지 이해가 안 돼요

translation.en: All I did was just trying to help people.
I didn't want anyone else to get hurt.
[Cecilie] But it was kind of nice to just see
and try to focus on the positive things that people were writing.
I could see the amount of shares.
Comment after comment after comment.
"Look at this story," you know. "It's just insane."
[Natalie] We were sitting there watching the numbers go up and up.
Everybody wanted to read The Tinder Swindler. It was going viral.
translation.ko: 다들 '틴더 사기꾼' 기사를 읽고 싶어 했죠 입소문을 탔거든요

translation.en: This is what I wanted. His face is there. His name is there.
translation.ko: 제가 바란 결과였죠 그 사람 얼굴과 이름이 알려졌잖아요

translation.en: No matter who he meets and he says, "Hi. My name is Simon Leviev,"
translation.ko: 앞으론 누굴 만나서 자기가 사이먼 레비예프라고 해도

translation.en: the moment they Google him now, it will be there.
I met Pernilla. Immediately, we had a bond.
This is the only person who really understands what I am going through.
translation.ko: 제 상황을 이해해 주는 유일한 사람인걸요

translation.en: [Cecilie] We wanted to keep the momentum up.
We joined forces.
Both of us had a goal that this needed to come out
in as many newspapers in as many countries as possible.
translation.ko: 최대한 많은 나라의 신문에 소개하는 거였죠

translation.en: -Hello. -Hi.
[reporter] First of all, I wanted to apologize
and let you know that not all Israeli men are such crooks.
translation.ko: 장담컨대 모든 이스라엘 남자가 그런 사기꾼은 아닙니다

translation.en: Talk shows and news agencies in the US, UK, Netherlands, Germany as well.
translation.ko: 토크 쇼, 언론사 미국, 영국, 네덜란드, 독일까지

translation.en: We needed more exposure and more countries to make their own investigations.
translation.ko: 더 널리 보도돼서 더 많은 국가가 수사해야 했죠

translation.en: Like, "What did he do in our country? Do we have any victims here?"
translation.ko: 그자가 그 나라에선 뭘 했고 피해자가 있는지요

translation.en: But another thing was to actually get the police
to feel the pressure from the media, the pressure from the public,
and do something about this.
[Natalie] The response was really overwhelming.
We were contacted by victims all over the world.
[woman 1] I met him on Tinder in 2015. We met up Copenhagen…
translation.ko: 2015년에 틴더에서 처음 알게 됐는데 - 코펜하겐에서 만났죠 - 6개월간 사귀었고

translation.en: [woman 2] We dated for around six months. He met my family and friends.
translation.ko: - 코펜하겐에서 만났죠 - 6개월간 사귀었고 - 제 가족과 친구들도 소개했죠 - 뉴욕에서 우리랑 지냈는데

translation.en: [man 1] He stayed with us in New York.
translation.ko: - 제 가족과 친구들도 소개했죠 - 뉴욕에서 우리랑 지냈는데

translation.en: He said his name was Shimon Yehuda Hayut.
translation.ko: - 이름은 시몬 예후다 하유트랬죠 - 자기 이름은

translation.en: -[woman 1] His name was Mordechay Tapiro. -[woman 2] His name was Simon Leviev.
translation.ko: - 이름은 시몬 예후다 하유트랬죠 - 자기 이름은 - 모데카이 타피로랬어요 - 사이먼 레비예프래요

translation.en: [man 2] My wife and I hired Simon to babysit our five-year-old son.
He was 20 years old at the time.
We knew that his father was a rabbi and he came from a very…
translation.ko: 아버지는 랍비라고 했고 - 가정 환경이… - 이스라엘 항공사 후계자라면서

translation.en: [woman 3] He told me he was heir to an Israeli airline.
He employed me as his PA. [man 3] He hired me as his personal chauffeur.
translation.ko: - 절 비서로 고용했죠 - 절 기사로 고용했어요

translation.en: And he hired a lot of expensive cars.
He never paid the bill. $300,000.
[woman 4] He told me that he was a Mossad agent
working undercover as a pilot.
[woman 1] He spent nearly $20,000.
[man 1] In just three days, he spent $42,000 on our Amex card.
translation.ko: 3일 만에 우리 아멕스 카드로 4만 2천 달러를 썼죠

translation.en: [man 3] Three of our checks had been forged.
[woman 2] Nearly $50,000 in total.
[woman 4] I'm still not over it, six years later.
I'm scared of him.
[Natalie] We got all this information,
but nothing happened to him.
He was still on the run, he was still a free man,
even though we knew that he was reported to the police
in at least seven different countries.
[woman] I was at the airport in Prague.
I had been visiting my boyfriend.
While I was waiting for my plane to leave,
I was scrolling through Instagram, and I saw the picture of my boyfriend.
translation.ko: 인스타그램을 훑다가 "아일린 샬럿" 제 남친 사진을 봤어요

translation.en: I clicked on it.
"The Tinder Swindler"?
What the fuck is this?
I was completely in shock.
I sent the article to Simon, and he started calling me.
We were about to take off,
so I downloaded the article and put my phone on airplane mode.
translation.ko: 전 기사를 내려받고 휴대폰에 비행기 모드를 켰죠

translation.en: I saw that this girl Cecilie met him on Tinder.
I also met him on Tinder.
He also took me to a five-star hotel on the first date.
translation.ko: 저도 첫 데이트 때 5성급 호텔로 데려갔고요

translation.en: I was already dating Simon for 14 months.
So we were in a serious relationship.
I loved him very much.
He was very thoughtful. He would remember every little thing.
translation.ko: 사려 깊은 사람이었는데 사소한 것까지 다 기억해 줬죠

translation.en: I shared my whole heart with him.
We started talking about settling down together, starting a family.
translation.ko: 함께 정착해서 가정을 꾸리자는 말도 나왔죠

translation.en: I really felt we were meant for each other.
I was scrolling through the article. I saw these videos coming up.
Cecilie, my love, I love you. I miss you. I can't wait to see you.
translation.ko: 세실리에, 사랑해 보고 싶다, 얼른 만나자

translation.en: He sent me the same video.
Ayleen, darling,
I miss you.
Peter.
I went through my WhatsApp history, and I started to compare.
translation.ko: 제 왓츠앱 기록을 띄워서 비교하기 시작했어요

translation.en: He was sending exactly the same words to her as he did to me.
translation.ko: 저랑 그 여자한테 똑같은 문자를 보냈더군요

translation.en: "Good morning, love. How are you? I love you. I miss you."
translation.ko: '좋은 아침, 자기야 잘 잤어?' '사랑해, 보고 싶어'

translation.en: "I wanna have babies with you."
He took Cecilie to Amsterdam, my hometown.
Exactly the same period as we were dating,
she was looking for houses to start living with him in London.
translation.ko: 그 여자는 런던에서 둘이 같이 살 집을 구했는데

translation.en: I was also looking for houses in Amsterdam.
The same day, he was flying to Oslo for a business trip,
translation.ko: 비행기 타고 오슬로로 출장 간 날엔

translation.en: he was just going out to see her.
translation.ko: 실은 그 여자를 보러 간 거예요

translation.en: He texted me, "I'm tired as fuck." Yeah, of course.
translation.ko: 저한테 '너무 피곤해'라고 문자 했는데 당연히 피곤했겠죠

translation.en: He was with Cecilie all night.
He told me that this business deal in Munich went wrong.
translation.ko: 뮌헨에 갔을 땐 거래가 틀어졌다고 했는데

translation.en: But he was meeting Pernilla.
[Simon] Peter is down!
He sent exactly the same pictures to me,
telling me that his enemies had beaten Peter up.
When I got those pictures, I was terrified.
translation.ko: 그 사진을 받고서 전 겁에 질렸어요

translation.en: It made me paranoid, constantly looking over my shoulder.
translation.ko: 전 편집증이 도져서 자꾸만 주변을 경계했죠

translation.en: A few years ago, I was followed by two guys and they beat me up.
translation.ko: 몇 년 전에 두 남자가 절 따라와서 폭행했는데

translation.en: I told Simon about this.
When Simon said I was being followed, I was full of anxiety all the time.
translation.ko: 사이먼이 저한테 미행이 붙었다길래 전 시종일관 불안감에 시달렸죠

translation.en: I'm reading that he is a fugitive.
translation.ko: "이스라엘 경찰 수배범" 기사를 보니 그이가 도망자래요

translation.en: A convicted criminal.
He swindled women for millions.
My heart almost stopped beating, because I also lent him money.
translation.ko: 심장이 멎을 뻔했어요 왜냐하면 저도 그이한테 돈을 빌려줬거든요

translation.en: It started off small.
